election_record.label: Massachusetts 1805 House of Representatives, York

overview.note: "York, May 14, 1805. Yesterday, old and young qualified to vote for Representatives turned out in this town, to choose a Member to the General Court: - The result of the exertion was, that Joseph Bragdon, Esq. - a friend to the Administrations of Washington, Adams and Strong, had 114 votes, and was elected in the room of democrat sent last year. The antifederal votes were 80." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 18, 1805.

election_record.reference: Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 18, 1805.
